data.title: Box Seats Boxed Us Out
data.text: "Jersey Boys" sounds fantastic. Unfortunately our box seats have kept us from seeing about half the stage. Come to the theater. Avoid the box!  Great show.

data.title: Great venue
data.text: We drove into Houston for a show on the weekend and the Hobby Center is great. Get to the venue early for parking as their lot does fill up fast.  You can valet park with front drop off.  It does take a while for the lifts to get you downstairs from the car park but if you want some exercise take the stairs.

data.title: Great Show: In The Heights!
data.text:
My wife, son, daughter and I visited yesterday for In the Heights.  We were not disappointed.  The Theatre is well kept, clean and has all the necessary facilities one would expect of a good evening out.  Valet parking, drinks etc.

This was not our first time and will not be our last as we continue to experience the best Houston has to offer in shows.  Well done!

data.title: WICKED friends
data.text: My friends and I attended on of the last WICKED shows at the HC and throughly enjoyed it. Although a few of us had seen the show before some had never been to a play. Thanks to the HC for providing an excellent experience to encourage more theatre outings! 💚

data.title: Pretty good
data.text: We went to see Wicked and it was the first time attending the musical at this location.  I had seen this particular musical on Broadway so there is a sense of comparison.  The show was outstanding.....acoustics pretty good with electronic help.  The music was just the right level and never over shadowed the performers.  The theater holds about 2500 people but there are some seating's offered that will make the experience a bit frustrating.  Good seats (cost) at this location are comparable to good seat on Broadway and it is silly thinking you don't pay for location.  What made this event great was the people that served the masses as we entered in the theater. All, save one person, was real professional and personable.  Watch out for the gregarious person whose main job (it seemed) was to enforce "no pictures or selfies" law within the theater.  It not the policy, it's the person enforcing it.

data.title: Great Show : Lackluster Theatre Experience
data.text:
As a Houstonian,  I am sad at the actual theatre experience at The Hobby Center.  The actual performance of Wicked was phenomenal,  exceptional in fact. 

The theatre experience...Rude ushers yelling at people not to take pictures,  even when they were not taking pictures. They kept yelling at people right in my ear as I was in the asile.

Crunching snack wrappers,  sippy cups of drinks, littered asiles, and allowing 50 plus people to enter the theatre after the show started, when the theatre rules state no entry till intermission. 

We bought some expensive cheap wine in plastic cups and were sitting at a table and got barked at by usher to get out since we were not eating food... Told us to read the sign. Asked her to show me the sign,  she snipped off and showed us... No sign! 

Come on Houston. We want to be a world class city,  how can we have such a poor theatre experience. 

Getting a taxi in the rain after?  Nope!

data.title: Great Acoustics, Not Such a Great View
data.text: Hobby Center for the Performing Arts boasts a beautiful lobby serving really good food (not snack food) almost up to show time. This helps when you want to work a full day and then catch a show but may not have time for a long dinner. The hosts encourage you to share a table with others (hearkens back to school days) because there may not be enough tables for all.  Hubs and I shared an entree and a glass of wine and we were set to thoroughly enjoy Wicked!!! The sound and lighting were outstanding. The seats were comfortable but we both squirmed a lot to see around patrons in front of us. We were not in the cheap seats either.  We'll definitely go again!!

data.title: Great Venues & Shows
data.text: Venue is nice. It's easy to get to off the interstate. Our seats were in the gallery. You have two choices....wait for elevator which had a long line or take the stairs. There are restaurants within walking distance. We ate at the Hard Rock Cafe before the show. This was a great Girls a Night Out!!

data.title: Lovely venue:  enjoyed Wicked there!
data.text:
My first visit to The Hobby Center, I found it to be a lovely theater, a convenient location, easy and quick entrance and exit, and with easy parking nearby. 

While it was my third time to see Wicked (different cities), what made this really special for me was the free ear buds for hearing impaired that was synched with their sound system!  For the first time, I could truly understand (hear) the words of the songs!!!  Maybe other theaters offer this, but it's the first time I've noticed the offer and/or used the device.  Simply amazing for folks with hearing loss!!!  They also offer a different device for people with cochlear implants.  Much appreciated!

data.title: Awesome show
data.text: I have seen a few shows here and it is truly amazing and I would recommend anyone to go. They will be impressed and want to see another one.

data.title: Easy breezy!!
data.text: So, we came to Houston as a surprise visit for my 8 year olds birthday so she could see Wicked!!! We stayed downtown so the venue was easy to locate. We were able to take advantage of the free valet for Lexus owners and everyone was very accommodating when I didn't know how to retrieve my electronic tickets via email. It's a beautiful venue. We sat on the Mezzanine level and were very pleased with our view of the stage.

data.title: Gallery Seats were Much Better than Expected!
data.text: We saw Wicked on a Sunday evening and since it was a last minute "hey let's go here for a fun date night" and we've never been to the theatre I thought I'd start w/the "cheap seats" in the Gallery and I WAS IMPRESSED! There's really not a bad seat in the whole place so if you want to save money to be able to go to more shows this is a great idea. Now you do loose a bit of the magic because you can see the person on stage but can't see details like if they're wearing glasses, facial expressions, costume details etc but they were the easiest seats to get in and out of the theatre we've ever experience at any theatre!  The show ended at 10:30 and since we were near the top row in the Gallery we were literally in our car in the parking garage by 10:45 because we were able to grab the first elevator and beat all the traffic out of the theatre. I'll buy those seats for every show unless it's a favorite show and I want to be in the thick of things - THOUGH THE SEATS ARE VERY SMALL - LIKE AIRLINE SEATS so you're on top of your neighbor so I'd rather have an aisle seat and be in the gallery than in the middle of a row even if it affords me a closer view - but that's just my opinion.

data.title: Amazing Experience Everytime!
data.text:
I've now attended two musicals at the Hobby Center and both experiences have been amazing! There is a parking garage right next to the center that I believe usually costs $12 a night but if you own a Lexus, there is usually complimentary valet parking at the front of the venue. There is always a long line to get into the parking garage so come a bit early. Upon exiting, it seems the valet parking takes a while but the garage parking seems to flow pretty quick. Oh and take the stairs to your level if you can. There's always a long line to go up the elevator!

There doesn't seem to be any real dress code but if you're going for a musical, keep in mind that most people dress up. Food and drinks for sale inside the venue but of course a bit pricey as to be expected. The staff is always friendly and helpful. Temperature of the venue varies. When I went to see Beauty and the Beast, it was a bit chilly but when I saw Wicked, it was a fine. For the ladies, I would just bring a light jacket just in case. Regarding seating, there really isn't a bad seat in the house. No photos when you're inside (they are very strict on this). 

Cheapest tickets can usually be found on Tuesday or Wednesday nights for musicals that play during those days. Obviously, the weekend tickets will be more expensive. 

Overall, awesome venue and great selection of musicals! Would highly recommend if you can attend!

data.title: Wicked the musical
data.text: Very nice.. Bathrooms clean... Drinks very good.. We did valet parking and took my vehicle quickly but took about 30 minutes to get after play...which wasn't to bad... Beautifully decorated.. The play was exceptional and we were in left orchestra row FF and they were good seats.. Attendants very helpful and friendly..

data.title: Wicked! So Fun! So Fabulous!
data.text:
Not everyone can get to New York City and see an authentic Broadway show (though they should try) and seeing one in person while touring is the next best thing. 

Wicked was magical. They acting was energetic, funny and the timing was impeccable. I sat mesmerized for the main part of the show and found myself holding my breath many times. Just breathe. Just Breathe. The script had the whole audience laughing out loud. The "Wicked Witch" had such a droll personality and humor. It reminded me of the old stand up comics that had always had the "deadpanning" side kick. Glinda's character was done so well. I grew to loathe her in many scenes reminiscent of stereotypical  popular cheerleaders and the games they played but she redeemed herself before the end. The storyline seamlessly incorporated the beloved characters from the original Oz and I squealed audibly with delight to see how the cast did that. Finally, the singing. Ah! The glorious singing. It was clear and floated like crystal bubbles in the air. At times, it wa throaty and emotional. Other times, it meandered into effervescent  excitement. I was sad to see it end. I now want to see it on Broadway. 

We easily found parking on the street within a 1/4 block from the theater. It was free because it was in the evening. I loved that police were there to help with traffic and pedestrians - it was a huge help. Our seats were on the mezzanine towards the left and were fabulous. I could see the stage and action clearly without obstructions and the sound was amazing. Seats 17 &18 (A) also were great for beating everyone to the restroom when intermission came. In addition, a large door leading outside to the back of the building was right beside us when it came time to leave.

data.title: Great venue
data.text: We saw Wicked here.  The seating is good - pretty much wherever you sit.  The temp was good - a tad warmer than I like but I wouldn't want to be chilly either.  The mass exodus after the show cleared out pretty quickly and parking is easy.

data.title: Bad Acoustics and Sound, Exit is a Nightmare
data.text: Saw "Wicked" last night with my husband and 25 yo son.  We agreed that the sound system buzzed and theatre acoustics were really bad.  I expected a better experience for this venue.  No complaints about the theatre attendants...they were all smiling and helpful.  No experience with the ladies room but husband said the lines looked bad.  He had no problem with the men's room, of course.  Son bought a t-shirt in the wrong size and it was exchanged without argument...very grateful for that.  Exiting the theatre at the end of the show is a nightmare.  There are not enough elevators and the dangerous, uncarpeted stairs get overcrowded very quickly.  I cannot imagine how people would get out quickly in the event of a fire, it's that bad.  Parking in the garage is also not advised.  One attendant in charge of directing foot traffic was not enough to prevent theatre-goers from walking in front of cars leaving the garage.  Which meant that cars could not leave the garage.  Guess Hobby Center is too cheap to hire off-duty police officers?  The attendant handling the garage elevators handled the crowds efficiently but I felt sorry for her overdressed for the heat as she was.  Overall, I think that the Alley Theatre/Jones Hall/Wortham Theatre complex handles things better on the exit.  Hobby Center should take note.  I strongly doubt we will be back.

data.title: Wicked!
data.text: Saw Wicked and loved the theater. Probably one of the easiest to park and get to in Houston. Lots of options to get out also make it easy to leave and not be stuck in a car line forever. Theater itself is beautiful and the staff were wonderful!

data.title: Great Theater
data.text: Attendants were helpful in finding my seat and organizing bathroom lines for quick use during intermission. Beautiful views of park and downtown from the balcony.

data.title: Great show!
data.text: We went and saw Wicked at the Hobby Center and the show is amazing. The line to get in was not bad at all and there was no wait. There are a large amount of stair in the building and you must climb them to the level to enter the theatre and to go down to the restrooms. The biggest problem that I have with the theater itself is that the seats are not staggered. I had the pleasure of sitting behind a giant man and couldn't see sound his head and shoulders.  If the seats had been staggered this would not happen to anyone. Luckily I was sitting between my younger sister and a great friend so I was able to lean to the side to be able to see the show that I paid $120 for my seat. The other thing is that drinks from the bar are expansive and the lines are LONG! Long, long, long. For a water or soda it is $3, for a cup to enter the theatre with is an additional $3 to any drink. A double alcoholic drink is $20. There is a food station set up that had made to order pasta, salads, sandwiches and chips. And, the food was good but costly. Make sure you get yourself in a seat that you can't get stuck behind a giant and you'll have a great time.
